April 2025 County of Marin EMS BLS C1
CARDIAC ARREST BLS
Indications
Unresponsive; no breathing or has agonal respirations; no pulse
START CPR CRITICAL INFORMATION
• Give O2
• Witnessed vs Unwitnessed
• Apply defibrillator pads in • Consider pre-cordial
anterior/posterior position thump witnessed and
• BLS RMC defibrillator not
immediately available
• Compress at 110 to 120 bpm
• Use metronome or similar
device
Yes Shockable Rhythm? No
• Mechanical CPR is
mandatory during
transportation
• Change compressors
every 2 minutes
Deliver • Minimize interruptions
CPR 2 min
• If hypothermic <95F, initiate
Shock
warming measures, start CPR,
and immediately transport
• Defibrillate per
manufacturer’s
recommendations
CPR 2 min
• Do not stop compressions
• Rhythm check
while defibrillator is charging
every 2 min
• Resume compressions
• Resume cycle until immediately after shock
ALS providers
Airway Management
arrive or ROSC is
• BLS airway preferred
detected
during first 5 minutes
• Use two-person BLS
airway management
whenever possible
• Avoid excessive
ventilation
• Consider i-gel airway if
unable to adequately
maintain BLS airway
• 30:2 compression/
ventilation ratio or
continuous compressions
with ventilations on the 10th
upstroke of compressions
